verses.name: Proverbs 15:1
verses.text: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:2
verses.text: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:3
verses.text: The eyes of the Lord are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:4
verses.text: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:5
verses.text: A fool despiseth his father’s instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:6
verses.text: In the house of the righteous is much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:7
verses.text: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish doeth not so.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:8
verses.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:9
verses.text: The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the Lord: but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:10
verses.text: Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: and he that hateth reproof shall die.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:11
verses.text: Hell and destruction are before the Lord: how much more then the hearts of the children of men?

verses.name: Proverbs 15:12
verses.text: A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:13
verses.text: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:14
verses.text: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:15
verses.text: All the days of the afflicted are evil: but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:16
verses.text: Better is little with the fear of the Lord than great treasure and trouble therewith.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:17
verses.text: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:18
verses.text: A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:19
verses.text: The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:20
verses.text: A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:21
verses.text: Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:22
verses.text: Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:23
verses.text: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it!

verses.name: Proverbs 15:24
verses.text: The way of life is above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:25
verses.text: The Lord will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:26
verses.text: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:27
verses.text: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:28
verses.text: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:29
verses.text: The Lord is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:30
verses.text: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: and a good report maketh the bones fat.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:31
verses.text: The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:32
verses.text: He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:33
verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.
